metadata.Title: CVE-2019-2969 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the MySQL Server product of Oracle MySQL (component: Client programs). Supported versions that are affected are 5.6.44 and prior, 5.7.26 and prior and 8.0.16 and prior. Easily exploitable vulnerability allows unauthenticated attacker with logon to the infrastructure where MySQL Server executes to compromise MySQL Server. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in unauthorized access to critical data or complete access to all MySQL Server accessible data. CVSS 3.0 Base Score 6.2 (Confidentiality impacts). CVSS Vector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:L/AC:L/PR:N/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:N/A:N).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2969` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-client - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-server - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> since 5.5 is no longer upstream supported and so far we cannot patch it marking as ignored.

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7.28-0ubuntu0.18.04.4').
